sen.j: 荒木 政羽（あらき まさはね、寛文2年（1662年） - 享保17年2月14日 (旧暦)（1732年3月10日））は江戸幕府の旗本。
sen.e: Masahane ARAKI (1662 – March 10, 1732) was hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) of Edo bakufu.
Masahane ARAKI (1662–March 10, 1732) was hatamoto (direct retainer) of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースと語句を削除しました。
sen.e: Masahane ARAKI (1662–March 10, 1732) was hatamoto (direct retainer) of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 幕府目付として元禄赤穂事件の処理に携わった。
sen.e: He dealt with Genroku Ako Incident as bakufu Metsuke (inspector of foot soldiers).
He dealt with Genroku Ako Incident as bakufu metsuke (inspector).
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースと語句を削除しました。
sen.e: He dealt with Genroku Ako Incident as bakufu metsuke (inspector).

sen.j: 通称は興十郎・内蔵助・十郎左衛門。
sen.e: His common names were Kojuro(興十郎), Kura no suke, and Jurozaemon.
sen.cmt: 興十郎：正しい読み方が不明です。
sen.e: His nicknames were Kojuro (興十郎), Kura no suke, and Jurozaemon.
sen.cmt: 「通称」の訳が不適切なので変更しました。
sen.e: His nicknames were Kojuro (興十郎), Kura no suke, and Jurozaemon.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下・志摩守。
sen.e: His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Shima no kami (Governor of Shima Province).
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Shima no kami (Governor of Shima Province).
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Shima no kami (Governor of Shima Province).

sen.j: 上総国武射郡に1,500石の所領を持っていた旗本の荒木十郎左衛門元知の長男として誕生。
sen.e: He was born as the oldest son of Jurozaemon mototomo ARAKI, hatamoto which had 1500 koku of shoryo (territory) in Musha Country, Kazusa Province.
He was born the oldest son to Jurozaemon mototomo ARAKI, hatamoto who had a territory of 1500 koku (crop yields) in Musha Country, Kazusa Province.
sen.cmt: 前置詞と関係代名詞を修正し、「石」の意味を追加しました。
sen.e: He was born the oldest son to Jurozaemon mototomo ARAKI, hatamoto who had a territory of 1500 koku (crop yields) in Musha Country, Kazusa Province.

sen.j: 母は黒川丹波守正直の娘。
sen.e: His mother was Kurokawa Tanba no kami Masanao's daughter.
His mother was Kurokawa Tanba no kami (Governor of Tanba Province) Masanao's daughter.
sen.cmt: 「丹波守」の説明を加えました。
sen.e: His mother was Kurokawa Tanba no kami (Governor of Tanba Province) Masanao's daughter.

sen.j: 天和 (日本)2年（1682年）7月11日、はじめて将軍徳川綱吉に拝謁。
sen.e: In August 13, 1682, he was granted an audience with shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA for the first time.
On August 13, 1682, he was granted an audience with shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA for the first time.
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞を修正しました。
sen.e: On August 13, 1682, he was granted an audience with shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA for the first time.

sen.j: 天和3年（1683年）9月25日、書院番に列した。
sen.e: In November 13, 1683, he was raised to Shoinban (the castle guards).
On November 13, 1683, he was raised to Shoinban (castle guard).
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞を修正し、余分なスペースを削除し、カッコ内を訂正ました。
sen.e: On November 13, 1683, he was raised to Shoinban (castle guard).

sen.j: 元禄10年（1697年）7月11日、父の死により家督相続するが、元禄11年（1698年）所領の一部を下総国匝瑳郡に移された。
sen.e: In August 27, 1697, he succeeded the position of family head due to his father's death, but in 1698, a part of his territory was removed to Sosa Country, Shimousa Province.
On August 27, 1697, he succeeded the position of family head due to his father's death, but in 1698, a part of his territory was removed to Sosa Country, Shimousa Province.
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞を修正しました。
sen.e: On August 27, 1697, he succeeded the position of family head due to his father's death, but in 1698, a part of his territory was removed to Sosa Country, Shimousa Province.

sen.j: 元禄12年（1699年）御使番に転じて、6月6日、尾張国尾張藩主の徳川綱誠の薨去に際しては、紀伊国紀州藩へ派遣されている。
sen.e: In 1699, he assumed Otsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield), and in July 2, when Tsunanari TOKUGAWA, the Lord of Owari Domain, died, he was dispatched to the Kishu Domain, Kii Province.
In 1699, he assumed Otsukaiban (messenger), and on July 2, when Tsunanari TOKUGAWA, the Lord of Owari Domain, died, he was dispatched to the Kishu Domain, Kii Province.
sen.cmt: 「御使番」は戦場以外でも活躍していた可能性があるようですので、カッコ内の説明にもっと幅を持たせました。カッコ内の余分なスペースを削除し、日付の前置詞を修正しました。
sen.e: In 1699, he assumed Otsukaiban (messenger), and on July 2, when Tsunanari TOKUGAWA, the Lord of Owari Domain, died, he was dispatched to the Kishu Domain, Kii Province.

sen.j: 12月18日に布衣の着用を許された。
sen.e: In February 6, he was allowed to put Hoi (clothing for kuge, court noble).
On February 6, 1700, he was allowed to wear Hoi (clothing for a lower-ranking retainer).
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞を修正し、カッコ内の余分なスペースを削除しました。年を追加しました。putをwearに変更しました。「布衣」は広辞苑で「無位無官の幕臣が着用した」と説明されていましたので、カッコ内の説明を変更しました（役職に就いてい記述がありますので、「無位無官」を直訳せずにlower-rankingとしました）。
sen.e: On February 6, 1700, he was allowed to wear Hoi (clothing for a lower-ranking retainer).

sen.j: 元禄14年（1701年）3月14日、浅野長矩が吉良義央に殿中刃傷に及んだため、赤穂城の改易城召し上げが決定された。
sen.e: In April 21, 1701, Naganori ASANO cut at Yoshinaka KIRA inside of the palace, so it was decided to Kaieki sanction (sudden dismissal and deprivation of position, privileges and properties) of Ako-jo Castle.

On April 21, 1701, since Naganori ASANO cut at Yoshinaka KIRA inside of the shogun's castle, it was decided to impose Kaieki punishment on Naganori, which means he would be dismissed and his castle called Ako-jo Castle would be confiscated.
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞と「殿中」の訳を修正しました。soは単独で節と節を結べないので、sinceを用いました。原文の「赤穂城の改易城召し上げ」は、城の没収のみを指すのか、官位剥奪と城の没収の両方を指すのか判断がつきかねましたが、両方を指しているとして訳を整理しました。
sen.e: On April 21, 1701, since Naganori ASANO cut at Yoshinaka KIRA inside of the shogun's castle, it was decided to impose Kaieki punishment on Naganori, which means he would be dismissed and his castle called Ako-jo Castle would be confiscated.

sen.j: 翌日15日、その収城目付（幕府目付職ではない）にこの荒木と榊原政殊が任命され、4月15日に赤穂入りした。
sen.e: The next day, in April 22, Araki and Masayoshi SAKAKIBARA were appointed to 収城 Metsuke (not bakufu metsuke) and they entered to Ako in May 22.
The next day, on April 22, Araki and Masayoshi SAKAKIBARA were appointed to 収城 Metsuke (different from bakufu metsuke), and they entered Ako on May 22.
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞を変更し、カッコ内の余分なスペースを削除しました。カッコ内を修正し、カッコの後にカンマを加えました。enteredの後の前置詞が不要なので削除しました。
sen.e: The next day, on April 22, Araki and Masayoshi SAKAKIBARA were appointed to 収城 Metsuke (different from bakufu metsuke), and they entered Ako on May 22.

sen.j: 4月18日、榊原・石原正氏（幕府代官）・岡田俊陳（幕府代官）とともに赤穂城を検分した。
sen.e: In May 25, Araki inspected Ako-jo Castle together with Sakakibara, Masauji ISHIHARA (local governor) and Toshinobu OKADA (local governor).
On May 25, Araki inspected Ako-jo Castle together with Sakakibara, Masauji ISHIHARA (local governor) and Toshinobu OKADA (local governor).
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞を変更し、カッコ内の余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: On May 25, Araki inspected Ako-jo Castle together with Sakakibara, Masauji ISHIHARA (local governor) and Toshinobu OKADA (local governor).

sen.j: このときの様子は落合勝信の「江赤見聞記」に詳しい。
sen.e: Katsunobu OCHIAI recorded the details of this inspection in his "Goseki-Kenbunroku" (Record of personal experience of Goseki).
Katsunobu OCHIAI recorded the details of this inspection in his 'Goseki-Kenbunki' (Record of personal experience of Goseki).
sen.cmt: カッコ内の余分なスペースを削除しました。「江赤見聞記」の読み方を修正し、" "を' 'に修正しました。
sen.e: Katsunobu OCHIAI recorded the details of this inspection in his 'Goseki-Kenbunki' (Record of personal experience of Goseki).

sen.j: 大石内蔵助はこの幕臣四名が金の間で休息中、お茶と菓子を勧め、浅野内匠頭の弟浅野長広をもっての浅野家再興を願い出たが、4人は何も答えてくれず、その場をさっさと立って大書院の方へ行ってしまった。
sen.e: When these 4 bakushins (shogun's retainers) took a rest in the golden chamber of the Castle, Kuranosuke OISHI invited tea and cake, and asked them for restoration of the Asano family by Nagahiro ASANO, brother of Asano Takumi no kami, but they replied nothing and left for Daishoin (large study) quickly.

When these four shogun's retainers took a rest in the golden chamber of the castle, Kuranosuke OISHI served them tea and sweets, and asked them to support restoration of the Asano family by Nagahiro ASANO, younger brother of Asano Takumi no kami, but they did not reply and left for Daishoin (large study) quickly.
sen.cmt: 「幕臣」「勧め」「答えてくれず」などの訳を修正しました。カッコ内の余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: When these four shogun's retainers took a rest in the golden chamber of the castle, Kuranosuke OISHI served them tea and sweets, and asked them to support restoration of the Asano family by Nagahiro ASANO, younger brother of Asano Takumi no kami, but they did not reply and left for Daishoin (large study) quickly.

sen.j: 内蔵助は大書院検分中の4人にもう一度同じことを願い出たが、また声をかけてもらえなかった。
sen.e: Kuranosuke asked them the same thing when they were inspecting Daishoin, but they neglected him again.
Kuranosuke asked them the same thing when they were inspecting Daishoin, but they neglected him again.
Kuranosuke asked them the same thing when they were inspecting Daishoin, but they neglected him again.

sen.j: 検分が終わり帰ろうとする4人を、内蔵助は玄関にて再びお茶を出して引き止め、3度浅野家再興を願い出た。
sen.e: When they were just about to go out after they finished inspection, Kuranosuke served tea again and kept them back, and asked for restoration of the Asano family for three times.
When they were just about to leave, having finished inspection, Kuranosuke offered them tea again to keep them, and mentioned restoration of the Asano family for the third time.
sen.cmt: 全体的に修正しました。
sen.e: When they were just about to leave, having finished inspection, Kuranosuke offered them tea again to keep them, and mentioned restoration of the Asano family for the third time.

sen.j: ついにここで大石の必死さを見かねた石原が荒木に対して「内蔵助の言い分は仕方のないものでしょう。江戸へ帰還ののち取りなしても問題はないと思いますが。｣と言ってくれた。
sen.e: At last, his desperate attitude disposed Ishihara to accept his request and said to Araki, 'I understand his say. I think there is no problem if we accept his request after we returned to Edo.'
At last, his desperate attitude disposed Ishihara to say to Araki, 'His request is understandable. I think there is no problem if we tell bakufu about this after we return to Edo.'
sen.cmt: 全体的に整理しました。
sen.e: At last, his desperate attitude disposed Ishihara to say to Araki, 'His request is understandable. I think there is no problem if we tell bakufu about this after we return to Edo.'

sen.j: 荒木も｢なるほど。確かに内蔵助の言い分も最もです。ご老中に取り次ごうと思いますが、采女殿はどう思いますか？」といい、榊原も「それでいいと思います」と答えたので、荒木は、内蔵助に「では、江戸へ帰り次第、その申し分を取り次ごう」と言ってくれ、内蔵助は「かたじけなく存じます」とお礼を述べたという流れである。
sen.e: Araki replied, ' That makes a lot of sense. I also understand what he said. So I will tell his desire to roju (senior councilor of the Tokugawa Shogunate), but how do you think, Uneme ?' and Sakakibara said ' I agree with you.', so Araki said to Kuranosuke ' Well, I will tell your desire to roju as soon as we returned to Edo' and Kuranosuke said him 'I thank you very much.'

Araki replied, 'That makes a lot of sense. I also understand what he said. So I'd like to ask roju (higher-ranking members of the cabinet of the Tokugawa Shogunate) to consider his request. What do you think, Uneme?' and Sakakibara answered, 'I agree with you,' and therefore Araki said to Kuranosuke, 'Then I will tell your wish to roju as soon as we get to Edo,' to which Kuranosuke responded, 'I thank you very much.'
sen.cmt: 全体的に整理しました。
sen.e: Araki replied, 'That makes a lot of sense. I also understand what he said. So I'd like to ask roju (higher-ranking members of the cabinet of the Tokugawa Shogunate) to consider his request. What do you think, Uneme?' and Sakakibara answered, 'I agree with you,' and therefore Araki said to Kuranosuke, 'Then I will tell your wish to roju as soon as we get to Edo,' to which Kuranosuke responded, 'I thank you very much.'

sen.j: 6月1日までに江戸に戻った荒木は、将軍徳川綱吉や老中若年寄らに収城の報告をおこない、大石から浅野家再興の嘆願に希望があったことも伝えたものの、結局、浅野長広は本家広島藩へお預けとなり、大石内蔵助の浅野家再興運動は挫折した。
sen.e: Araki returned to Edo before July 6, and reported the inspection to Shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA, roju and wakadoshiyori (junior councilor), further he told them Oishi's desire to restore the Asano family, but Nagahiro ASANO was left to his head family Hiroshima Domain in the end, so Kuranosuke OISHI's activity for the restoration of the Asano family was failed.

Araki returned to Edo no later than July 6, and reported the inspection to Shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA, roju and wakadoshiyori (lower-ranking members of the cabinet), and also he told them about Oishi's desire to restore the Asano family, but nevertheless, Nagahiro ASANO ended up being left to his head family Hiroshima clan, and this is how Kuranosuke OISHI's activity for the restoration of the Asano family was failed.
sen.cmt: 全体的に調整しました。
sen.e: Araki returned to Edo no later than July 6, and reported the inspection to Shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA, roju and wakadoshiyori (lower-ranking members of the cabinet), and also he told them about Oishi's desire to restore the Asano family, but nevertheless, Nagahiro ASANO ended up being left to his head family Hiroshima clan, and this is how Kuranosuke OISHI's activity for the restoration of the Asano family was failed.

sen.j: 8月28日、荒木は幕府目付に就任した。
sen.e: In September 30, Araki assumed bakufu metsuke.
On September 30, Araki assumed bakufu metsuke.
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞を変更しました。
sen.e: On September 30, Araki assumed bakufu metsuke.

sen.j: その後、赤穂浪士たちは吉良邸へ討ち入り、亡君の仇吉良義央を討ち取った。
sen.e: After that, Ako roshi (lordless samurai of Ako Domain) raid into Kira-tei Residence and revenged their lord's death on Yoshinaka KIRA.
After that, Ako roshi (lordless samurai of Ako Domain) raided Kira-tei Residence and avenged their lord's death on Yoshinaka KIRA.
sen.cmt: カッコ内の余分なスペースを削除しました。raidを過去形にしました。revengedをavengedに修正しました。
sen.e: After that, Ako roshi (lordless samurai of Ako Domain) raided Kira-tei Residence and avenged their lord's death on Yoshinaka KIRA.

sen.j: 幕府の裁決で四十七士は全員切腹と決まったが、不思議な縁で、荒木は、元禄16年（1703年）2月4日、細川綱利邸（大石内蔵助の預けられ先）へ派遣されて、大石良雄らの検死役をつとめることとなった。
sen.e: According to bakufu's decision, all 47 roshi had to Seppuku, and Araki was dispatched to Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA –tei Residence in March 20, 1703 to hold an inquest on Yoshio OISHI and others by mysterious relationship.

Bakufu decided that all 47 roshi should commit seppuku, and Araki was dispatched to Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA–tei Residence (the place where Kuranosuke OISHI was kept) on March 20, 1703 to hold an inquest on Yoshio OISHI and others by a curious turn of fate.
sen.cmt: 「全員切腹と決まったが、不思議な縁で」の訳を変更し、「（大石内蔵助の預けられ先）」を訳出しました。
sen.e: Bakufu decided that all 47 roshi should commit seppuku, and Araki was dispatched to Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA–tei Residence (the place where Kuranosuke OISHI was kept) on March 20, 1703 to hold an inquest on Yoshio OISHI and others by a curious turn of fate.

sen.j: 元禄16年（1703年）6月28日より京都で霊元天皇付きとなり、この時に500石を加増。
sen.e: From August 10, 1703, he attended the Emperor Reigen in Kyoto and then he was added 500 koku.
From August 10, 1703, he attended Emperor Reigen in Kyoto, and at that time he got a raise by 500 koku.
sen.cmt: theを削除し、「この時に」「加増」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: From August 10, 1703, he attended Emperor Reigen in Kyoto, and at that time he got a raise by 500 koku.

sen.j: また11月6日には従五位下・志摩守に叙任した。
sen.e: Further, in December 14, he assumed Jugoinoge, Shima no kami.
Moreover, on December 14, he assumed Jugoinoge, Shima no kami.
sen.cmt: 「また」の訳を変更し、日付の前置詞を修正しました。
sen.e: Moreover, on December 14, he assumed Jugoinoge, Shima no kami.

sen.j: のち霊元天皇より直々に鼓を賜っている。
sen.e: Later, he was encouraged by the Emperor Reigen personally.
Later, he was encouraged by Emperor Reigen personally.
Later, he was encouraged by Emperor Reigen personally.

sen.j: しかし正徳 (日本)5年（1715年）12月に突然職務中に不手際があったとして小普請役に落とされて、500石の加増も取り消され、出仕を留められた。
sen.e: However, in December 1715, suddenly he was demoted to Kobushinyaku (commissioners of minor repairs of houses) because there was a blunder in his job, further, was retracted increase of 500 koku of shoryo and was suspended to enter government service.

However, in December 1715 (old calendar), accused of having made a blunder on the job, he was suddenly demoted to Kobushinyaku (originally having the duty of providing workers for minor repairs of buildings), and furthermore, the increase of 500 koku was taken away, and he was suspended from his work.
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストに従って、(old calendar)を加えました。「職務中に不手際があったとして」「500石の加増も取り消され、出仕を留められた」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: However, in December 1715 (old calendar), accused of having made a blunder on the job, he was suddenly demoted to Kobushinyaku (originally having the duty of providing workers for minor repairs of buildings), and furthermore, the increase of 500 koku was taken away, and he was suspended from his work.

sen.j: 享保元年（1716年）5月1日に赦免されたが、享保16年（1731年）5月27日には隠居し、家督を長男政為に譲った。
sen.e: He was forgiven in June 20, 1716, but retired in July 1, 1731 and transferred the reigns of the family to his oldest son Masatame.
He was forgiven on June 20, 1716, and retired on July 1, 1731, and transferred the reigns of the family to his oldest son Masatame.
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞を修正しました。
sen.e: He was forgiven on June 20, 1716, and retired on July 1, 1731, and transferred the reigns of the family to his oldest son Masatame.

sen.j: 翌年2月14日に死去。
sen.e: In March 10, 1732, he died.
On March 10, 1732, he died.
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞を修正しました。
sen.e: On March 10, 1732, he died.

sen.j: 享年71。
sen.e: He died at the age of 71.
He was 71.
sen.cmt: 前文との重複を避けました（用語統一リストのDied at the age of XXは、年表ではないこの文には不適切と思われるので、使用しませんでした）。
sen.e: He was 71 years old at the time of his death.

sen.j: 法名は了白。
sen.e: His homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has dies or has entered the priesthood) was Ryohaku (了白).
sen.cmt: 了白: 正しい読み方が不明です。
sen.e: His homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has died) was Ryohaku (了白).
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除し、diesを修正し、「法名」の説明をこの場合に当てはまるものだけにしました。
sen.e: His homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has died) was Ryohaku (了白).

sen.j: ちなみに荒木の娘は、殿中刃傷の際に浅野長矩を押し留めたことで有名な梶川頼照の孫秀照と結婚しており、またこの縁で荒木の三男政方も、梶川上秀と改名して、梶川家の養子に迎え入れられている。
sen.e: By the way, Araki's daughter married Hideteru, grandchild of Yoriteru KAJIKAWA who was famous by having suppressed Ninjo (sword fight) of Naganori ASANO inside of the palace, and by this relationship, Araki's third son Masamichi changed his name to Uehide(上秀) KAJIKAWA, and was adopted to the Kajikawa family.
sen.cmt: 上秀: 正しい読み方が不明です。
sen.e: Incidentally, Araki's daughter married Hideteru, grandchild of Yoriteru KAJIKAWA, who was known to have stopped Naganori ASANO during the sword fight in the castle, and due to this relationship, Araki's third son Masamichi changed his name to Uehide (上秀) KAJIKAWA, and was adopted to the Kajikawa family.
sen.cmt: 「刀傷」のローマ字は不要と思われるので削除しました。「ちなみに」「で有名な」の訳を変更しました。
